p: Noticeably, the difference of the effect on cell-cycle associated protein expression between CHP-treated and CHL-treated groups might be due to the compositional differences of the two extracts, as shown by the GC-MS analysis. GC-MS analysis ( Table 4 and Table 6) revealed that phytochemical constituents of isooxypeucedanin, Î±-terpineol and umbelliferone were only found in CHP and exerted antidiabetic effect by normalizing blood glucose level and re-establishing insulin sensitivity [ 57, 58, 66]. The previous studies showed the effect of certain antidiabetic drugs on the cell-cycle through the decrease of cyclin D1 expression [ 118]. Cyclin D1 is an essential link between cell-cycle and energy control metabolism [ 119]; this may explain why CHP was only effective in reducing cyclin D1 protein expression but not pRb and pcdc2 expression.
